channel.title: Coordinates?
channel.description:
I just have a question, can someone explain "coordinates" and how to find them when scripting?
like
for example:
FindColorSpiral(x,y,4938439,coord,coord,coord,coord)
Can someone explain how to get those?

I got it too from a Sythe forum right after I did this, but thanks anyway guys!

item.title: Coordinates?
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

Sure, those coords would search inside a box/rectangle.

FindColorSpiral(x,y,4938439,xs,ys,xe,ye).

Those are the coords you are looking for the color 4938439 in (xs,ys,xe,ye.)

In order to find coords, you must first Set the crosshairs from SCAR onto the client you are using.

In order to find coords, Open up your Runescape client, and SCAR (SCAR in the backround, make sure you can see the bottom.) If you hover your mose over the Selected client, you will see numbers moving on the bottom left hand corner of SCAR. The first number is the x coordinate, the second is the y coordinate. Start at where you want the box to start, then find the coords of that spot. After doing that, find the coords of other corner of the box, like this:
ys
xs ±---------+
| |
| Square |
| |
| |
±---------+xe
ye

I hope that helps, I don’t think I explained it well enough though. :\

Edit: KyleGut3 got to it before me…

Read full topic

item.title: Coordinates?
item.dc:creator: @KyleGut3 KyleGut3
item.description:
@KyleGut3 wrote:

Alright check it out. Those last set of 4 co-ords are kind of setting up a box, an area for the procedure to look in

x1,y1 ---------------|
| |
| |
|------------------x2,y2

With those co-ords, it would look for the color inside the box that they make.

Read full topic
